topic_metadata.title: How to add a space after a footnote number?

posts.name: jsx97
posts.cooked:
How can I add a space after a footnote number, so that it will be not this:

--------

but this?

--------

I tried the following example from Typst docs and it works fine:

#show footnote.entry: it => {
  let loc = it.note.location()
  numbering(
    "1. ",
    ..counter(footnote).at(loc),
  )
  it.note.body
}

posts.raw:
How can I add a space after a footnote number, so that it will be not this:

```none
--------

```

but this?

```none
--------
Â¹ Footnote
```

I tried the following example from Typst docs and it works fine:

```typ
#show footnote.entry: it => {
  let loc = it.note.location()
  numbering(
    "1. ",
    ..counter(footnote).at(loc),
  )
  it.note.body
}

Lorem ipsum#footnote[Dolor sit amet]

Lorem ipsum#footnote[Dolor sit amet]
```

But when I tried to replace `"1. "` with `"#super[1 ]"`, it treats `#super` literally.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
A very simple one line fix is:

" " + it.note.body
// Or as a unit
h(0.2em) + it.note.body

For more on #h() see here.

posts.name: Laurenz MÃ¤dje
posts.cooked:
jsx97:

#super[1 ]

Instead of putting the super into the "1.", put it around the numbering. Like this:

super(numbering(
  "1. ",
  ..counter(footnote).at(loc),
))

The string in the numbering is a numbering pattern rather than arbitrary content.
posts.raw:
[quote="jsx97, post:1, topic:1639"]
#super[1 ]
[/quote]

Instead of putting the `super` into the `"1."`, put it around the numbering. Like this:
```typc
super(numbering(
  "1. ",
  ..counter(footnote).at(loc),
))
```
The string in the numbering is a numbering pattern rather than arbitrary content.
